question.instruction: Look at the text below. In 40 seconds, you must read this text aloud as naturally and clearly as possible. You have 40 seconds to read aloud.

template.description: People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals are a leader in the anti-zoo movement. "PETA is firmly opposed to keeping wild animals in captivity," Lisa Wathne, the group's exotic animal specialist, told Current Events. "There are some animals, such as tigers and elephants, which roam large areas in the wild that should never be held captive.
template.title: Speaking - Read Aloud - Q1

question.instruction: Look at the text below. In 40 seconds, you must read this text aloud as naturally and clearly as possible. You have 40 seconds to read aloud.

template.description: The man who painted the famous Mona Lisa was Leonardo da Vinci, an Italian artist born in the 15th century. Da Vinci was interested in many different fields. He studied art, medicine, and flight. He also invented a few things. Some people consider him a genius. His depiction of Jesus Christ in The Last Supper is also very well known. It took Leonardo da Vinci 3 years to paint The Last Supper.
template.title: Speaking - Read Aloud - Q2

question.instruction: Look at the text below. In 40 seconds, you must read this text aloud as naturally and clearly as possible. You have 40 seconds to read aloud.

template.description: In 1808 the French armies invaded Spain under the command of Napoleon Bonaparte. Life in Spain got harder, and Goya’s paintings became darker. The situation depressed Goya. The mood of his pieces reflected his sadness about the invasion.
template.title: Speaking - Read Aloud - Q3

question.instruction: Look at the text below. In 40 seconds, you must read this text aloud as naturally and clearly as possible. You have 40 seconds to read aloud.

template.description: During an experiment at the Twin Pines Mall in Hill Valley, California, Marty videotapes the car as it accelerates to 88 miles per hour. Then it disappears in a burst of smoke and flames. One minute later, the car reappears precisely where it disappeared. It has traveled exactly one minute into the future.
template.title: Speaking - Read Aloud - Q4

question.instruction: Look at the text below. In 40 seconds, you must read this text aloud as naturally and clearly as possible. You have 40 seconds to read aloud.

template.description: Alex runs Wolf Camp. At Wolf Camp kids learn about wolves. The day before, Alex helped the kids make enrichment boxes for the wolves. They put catnip, blackberries, and oranges, into boxes. Alex left the boxes in the wolf pen for the wolves to examine. “Anything to stimulate their sense of taste and sense of smell is interesting for the wolves,” says Alex.
template.title: Speaking - Read Aloud - Q5

question.instruction: Look at the text below. In 40 seconds, you must read this text aloud as naturally and clearly as possible. You have 40 seconds to read aloud.

template.description: Cigarette smoke is a common problem for kids with asthma no matter where they live, says Robert Simpson, a lung doctor and internal medicine specialist in St. Louis. It’s a problem not only for kids who live with adults who smoke, but also for kids with asthma who give in to peer pressure to smoke.
template.title: Speaking - Read Aloud - Q6

question.instruction: Look at the text below. In 40 seconds, you must read this text aloud as naturally and clearly as possible. You have 40 seconds to read aloud.

template.description: Earth’s rigid outer shell is made up of vast rocky pieces called tectonic plates. These plates move as slowly as fingernails grow. They separate, collide, or grind against each other at plate boundaries. Where the plates grind together, pressure builds up and the rocks eventually break. This sends stored‐up energy surging through Earth. This energy is what causes earthquakes.
template.title: Speaking - Read Aloud - Q7

question.instruction: Look at the text below. In 40 seconds, you must read this text aloud as naturally and clearly as possible. You have 40 seconds to read aloud.

template.description: While Europeans were in the midst of the Dark Ages, Mayans never stopped learning. They tried out new farming methods. They rotated their crops so the soil would last longer. They only farmed crops on the same field once every three years or so. Turkey and ducks were tamed and kept on Mayan farms. That way, Mayans wouldn’t have to worry about hunting or trapping food.
template.title: Speaking - Read Aloud - Q1

question.instruction: Look at the text below. In 40 seconds, you must read this text aloud as naturally and clearly as possible. You have 40 seconds to read aloud.

template.description: High up in the Andes Mountains, the Incas built suspension bridges out of braids of vine and rope. These bridges were very strong. One bridge built over a deep river valley above the river Apurimac lasted for 500 years! Famous examples of suspension bridges today are the San Francisco Bay Bridge and the Brooklyn Bridge. But the Incan bridges were the first suspension bridges in the world!
template.title: Speaking - Read Aloud - Q2

question.instruction: Look at the text below. In 40 seconds, you must read this text aloud as naturally and clearly as possible. You have 40 seconds to read aloud.

template.description: Bamboo represents values and qualities the literati admired in nature. It is supple and graceful, but also tough and unbreakable. Like a pine tree, it is an evergreen, which means it thrives in the winter. In Chinese, the word for “node” (a bump on a branch) or “joining point” sounds just like the word for “integrity,” and bamboo has many nodes.
template.title: Speaking - Read Aloud - Q3

question.instruction: Look at the text below. In 40 seconds, you must read this text aloud as naturally and clearly as possible. You have 40 seconds to read aloud.

template.description: Michael Newdow has fought for years to have the phrase "under God" officially removed from the pledge. Newdow argues that the words conflict with the First Amendment to the Constitution. That amendment states, "Congress shall make no law respecting an establishment of religion."
template.title: Speaking - Read Aloud - Q4

question.instruction: Look at the text below. In 40 seconds, you must read this text aloud as naturally and clearly as possible. You have 40 seconds to read aloud.

template.description: Coltan is the informal name for columbite-tantalite, a dull black mineral. A mineral is a naturally occurring solid that forms geologically. It is classified on the basis of chemical makeup, crystal structure, and physical properties, such as hardness, color, and luster.
template.title: Speaking - Read Aloud - Q5

question.instruction: Look at the text below. In 40 seconds, you must read this text aloud as naturally and clearly as possible. You have 40 seconds to read aloud.

template.description: Thus people who are interested in serious science should be extremely cautious when they read an online story that purports to be a paradigm-shifting scientific discovery. A recent example is one suggesting that a new force of nature might have been discovered. If true, that would mean that we have to rewrite the textbooks.
template.title: Speaking - Read Aloud - Q6

question.instruction: Look at the text below. In 40 seconds, you must read this text aloud as naturally and clearly as possible. You have 40 seconds to read aloud.

template.description: China is the largest CO2 polluter on the planet, just ahead of the United States. And now the world’s most populous nation is pledging to cut the carbon intensity of its economy nearly in half by the end of the decade, by becoming more energy efficient. But Dabo Guan, an economist with the University of East Anglia says rapid growth in China means carbon emissions will still keep rising.
template.title: Speaking - Read Aloud - Q7

question.instruction: Once this template is on, recording will start after 25 seconds. Before the recording starts, there is a "beep sound". Time for recording will be 40 seconds.

template.description: Look at the image below. In 25 seconds, please speak into the microphone and describe in details what the map is showing. You will have 40 seconds to give your response.
template.title: Speaking - Describe Image - Q18
template.transcript: As per the given line graph Cairo, Egypt has the lowest temperature in January and increases to its highest by mid of June-July as it reaches from 55 Fahrenheit to 80 plus and after July starts dropping whereas Mombasa, Kenya has the highest temperature of 80 Fahrenheit, which has a slight decline and then again shows a growth and reaches to 80 Fahrenheit in December. However, Cape town, South Africa has 70 Fahrenheit temperature which the least in July at 55 and again rises to approx 70 by December.

question.instruction: Once this template is on, recording will start after 25 seconds. Before the recording starts, there is a "beep sound". Time for recording will be 40 seconds.

template.description: Look at the image below. In 25 seconds, please speak into the microphone and describe in details what the map is showing. You will have 40 seconds to give your response.
template.title: Speaking - Describe Image - Q19
template.transcript: The bar graph provides the information about hours of daylight and number of muffins baked, in January the hours spent were less compared to Muffins baked whereas in the same 10 hours of daylight the baked muffins reduced in numbers from Feb to May and hours spent increased. In June, July and August the hours of daylight were approximately 15 and the muffins produced were the least in numbers. However, after September the hours of daylight rose with the incline in muffins.

question.instruction: Once this template is on, recording will start after 25 seconds. Before the recording starts, there is a "beep sound". Time for recording will be 40 seconds.

template.description: Look at the image below. In 25 seconds, please speak into the microphone and describe in details what the map is showing. You will have 40 seconds to give your response.
template.title: Speaking - Describe Image - Q20
template.transcript: The bar and line chart reveals about the recent home sales along with the average price. To start with, in January, the average price of homes was 400 whereas the sale was at its peak with 275 houses sold, as in Feb the price increased and the sale dropped. From March till June the price of the houses plunged from 430 to 400 and sales fluctuated in the given months with the maximum in April as the houses were between 250 and 300.

question.instruction: Once this template is on, recording will start after 25 seconds. Before the recording starts, there is a "beep sound". Time for recording will be 40 seconds.

template.description: Look at the image below. In 25 seconds, please speak into the microphone and describe in details what the map is showing. You will have 40 seconds to give your response.
template.title: Speaking - Describe Image - Q21
template.transcript: The table chart illustrates about the proportion of each household type living in poverty in Australia, as per the given information maximum population of sole parent which was 21% were under poverty followed with 19% of the single with no children and 12% of couple with children whereas the percentage of single aged person, aged couple and couple with no children was below 7% with the least percentage of aged couple. Overall, 11% of total population of 1, 837,000 was under poverty.

template.description: Look at the image below. In 25 seconds, please speak into the microphone and describe in details what the map is showing. You will have 40 seconds to give your response.

question.instruction: Once this template is on, recording will start after 25 seconds. Before the recording starts, there is a "beep sound". Time for recording will be 40 seconds.

template.description: Look at the image below. In 25 seconds, please speak into the microphone and describe in details what the map is showing. You will have 40 seconds to give your response.
template.title: Speaking - Describe Image - Q23
template.transcript: The flowchart describes the various processes one customer has to go through once he makes request for the policy, once the balance is alright, the policy is checked and after previewing it if the answer is positive then the log transaction is done and the cash is given to the client, on the other hand if inquiry goes negative the whole process ends there.

question.instruction: Once this template is on, recording will start after 25 seconds. Before the recording starts, there is a "beep sound". Time for recording will be 40 seconds.

template.description: Look at the image below. In 25 seconds, please speak into the microphone and describe in details what the map is showing. You will have 40 seconds to give your response.
template.title: Speaking - Describe Image - Q24
template.transcript: The diagram differentiates between food eaten during frontier days and today. During frontier days people preferred hard track food along with cow or goat milk, open range meat whereas today people choose to eat fast food, ice cream and domesticated meats. In past people were dependent on spring water and homegrown veggies but today's population depends on city water and supermarket veggies along with pancakes and chocolate compared to Johny cakes and chicken fried Armadillos. However, the things prioritized by both are butter, bread, spices, berries and baking soda.

question.instruction: Once this template is on, track will start after "3 seconds". Once track will be completed, recording will start after "10 seconds" with a "beep sound". Time for recording will be "40 seconds".

template.description: You will hear a lecture. After listening to the lecture, in 10 seconds, please speak into the microphone and retell what you have just heard from the lecture in your own words. You will have 40 seconds to give your response.
template.title: Speaking - Retell Lecture - Q25
template.transcript: The lecture is on road congestion which is a pervasive phenomenon existing in all the cities around the world. For example, European cities, with a dense urban core, good public transportation mostly have not a lot of road capacity but on the other hand American cities are moving by itself. The traffic planners all around the world have tried lots of different measures but nothing seems to work but all attempts are figuring out what people should do instead of rush hour car driving is planning their life for themselves.

question.instruction: Once this template is on, track will start after "3 seconds". Once track will be completed, recording will start after "10 seconds" with a "beep sound". Time for recording will be "40 seconds".

template.description: You will hear a lecture. After listening to the lecture, in 10 seconds, please speak into the microphone and retell what you have just heard from the lecture in your own words. You will have 40 seconds to give your response.
template.title: Speaking - Retell Lecture - Q26
template.transcript: The lecture is on Tapirs which are mostly found in tropical forests such as the Amazon but their habitat is being destroyed as they are hunted out of several parts of their geographic distribution. This is unfortunate as Tapirs play the major role in shaping and maintaining the structure and diversity of the forest as being herbivores by nature they disperse throughout the habitat through their feces. So the extinction of tapirs would seriously affect biodiversity as a whole.

question.instruction: Once this template is on, track will start after "3 seconds". Once track will be completed, recording will start after "10 seconds" with a "beep sound". Time for recording will be "40 seconds".

template.description: You will hear a lecture. After listening to the lecture, in 10 seconds, please speak into the microphone and retell what you have just heard from the lecture in your own words. You will have 40 seconds to give your response.
template.title: Speaking - Retell Lecture - Q27
template.transcript: The speaker talks on American transportation system which started with horses and boats which now includes everything from container trucks to airplanes to motorcycles. But still some places struggle with traffic problems as more and more cars fill the roads. The answer to this is hybrid cars using both gas and electricity which save fuel and reduce pollution, the another major concern is the loss of natural areas with more developments as its the largest economy in the world which is on the move.
